name: NPR
text:
RT @SachaPfeiffer: Dead people aren't the only ones who mistakenly received $1,200 stimulus checks in the coronavirus pandemic.

So did thousands of foreign workers who entered the U.S. on temporary work visas and now live overseas, including in Mongolia, Pakistan & Russia. https://t.co/iIzHUFZUGN

name: NPR
text:
When Rep. Joe Kennedy III launched a challenge for the Senate seat of a progressive stalwart who co-sponsored the Green New Deal, some Democrats in Massachusetts wondered: Why?

"It's unfortunate that we can't have both in D.C.," one voter says. https://t.co/9C33tJhoXe

name: NPR
text: When you think of author and illustrator Arnold Lobel, you probably think of Frog and Toad, his amphibian forever friends — but this story of loving things and letting them go deserves a fresh look. https://t.co/oj1fMYMKIs

name: NPR
text:
At a Black Lives Matter protest, a young Korean American man named Edmond Hong grabbed a megaphone. Addressing other Asian Americans, he described the need to stop being quiet in the fight against racism. 

Hear why on this episode of @NPRCodeSwitch: https://t.co/Lqrbz0tUqF https://t.co/B7tLW90DtN

name: NPR
text: Name a famous person in history (5,4). The letters of the last name can be rearranged to name a popular game. And the letters in the first name can be rearranged to name an action in this game. Who is this famous person?  https://t.co/M8bS6FSTLK

name: NPR
text: Whether it's curtailing the spread of the virus in their communities, or losing the typical influx of student spending that arrives each fall, college towns are bracing for a challenge. https://t.co/coeh1EMVes

name: NPR
text:
BLD PWR cofounder Kendrick Sampson's sphere of influence in Hollywood made the nonprofit's mission clear: 

Organize to dismantle systemic oppression and create a culture of liberation within the entertainment industry. @hereandnow https://t.co/AoXrdLYkI3

name: NPR
text:
Census advocates fear the shortened time for processing responses is likely to further undermine data accuracy and exacerbate undercounts of people of color, immigrants, and other historically undercounted groups.
https://t.co/Ez1vfd9y4c

name: NPR
text: Awards shows often take place amid distractions, from natural disasters to civil unrest to the aftermath of a high-profile death. Sunday night's MTV Video Music Awards had to coexist with all three, not to mention a worldwide pandemic. https://t.co/y7tIBwQRqZ

name: NPR
text:
After Jacob Blake’s shooting, Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers compelled the Legislature into a special session Monday to push police reform. 

But the GOP argues it needs more time — and lawmakers aren’t expected to be present. 
https://t.co/XUtj2moxY7

name: NPR
text:
During past storms, gyms and stadiums turned into giant shelters. 

But with COVID-19 cases rising before Hurricane Laura, those shelters — and other protocols for evacuation and recovery — represented a new danger of their own. 
https://t.co/6v9cqYLMBm
